API Reference

class mgconfig.configuration.Configuration(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Singleton representing application configuration values.

Configuration values are loaded from environment variables and JSON configuration files. If a value is not found in these sources, a default from the configuration definitions is used. Configuration items are accessible via attribute-style access or dictionary-like access.

property data_rows: Sequence[Mapping[str, Any]]

Return all configuration values and their metadata as rows.

Each row contains metadata and the current value of a configuration item. If a pending new value exists, it is included as a separate row.

Returns:

List of dictionaries representing configuration items.

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

get_config_item(config_id: str, fail_on_error: bool = True) → ConfigItem | None[source]

Retrieve the ConfigItem object associated with a configuration ID.

Parameters:

  • config_id (str) – The configuration identifier.

  • fail_on_error (bool, optional) – Whether to raise an error if the item is not found. Defaults to True.

Returns:

The ConfigItem object if found, or None if fail_on_error is False.

Return type:

Optional[ConfigItem]

Raises:

ValueError – If the configuration ID is not found and fail_on_error is True.

get_value(config_id: str, fail_on_error: bool = False) → Any[source]

Retrieve the current value of a configuration item.

Parameters:

  • config_id (str) – The configuration identifier.

  • fail_on_error (bool, optional) – Whether to raise an error if the value is not found. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The configuration value, or None if not found and fail_on_error is False.

Return type:

Any

Raises:

ValueError – If the configuration ID is not found and fail_on_error is True.

str

save_new_value(config_id: str, new_value: Any, apply_immediately: bool = False) → bool[source]

Save a new configuration value to the underlying store.

Parameters:

  • config_id (str) – The configuration identifier.

  • new_value (Any) – The new value to save.

  • apply_immediately (bool, optional) – Whether to apply the value immediately to the current instance. Defaults to False. Values of secret type are always applied immediately.

Returns:

True if the value was saved successfully, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
